intro: Riedlea dichotoma, commonly known as the forked riedlea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive bifurcated stem and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, round fruits. Riedlea dichotoma is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest understory.
